reason: The market is showing clear signs of distribution, with Bitcoin ETF outflows erasing early-month gains and general optimism fading. The current hold near $91,000 is fragile, overshadowed by significant FUD from a major altcoin hack and XRP liquidations. Furthermore, looming macroeconomic uncertainty surrounding the Trump tariff ruling adds a layer of systemic risk. While Bitcoin shows some resilience, the cumulative negative catalysts suggest a bias towards further downside or prolonged consolidation under selling pressure. A breakdown of current support could trigger a swift markdown.
headlines: Bitcoin ETF optimism fades as three-day outflows streak erases early-month gains
Builders behind popular Zcash wallet Zashi to launch new startup 'cashZ'
Truebit token crashes 99.9% after hacker drains $26.6 million in ether
XRP slips to $2.12 after liquidations clear both sides of the futures book
Bitcoin holds near $91,000 as market awaits Trump tariff ruling: Asia Morning Briefing
